commitmsg: Merge branch 'release/1.0.4'
Bump the revision number.
Get the other <n> ways of launching the new account working.
Merge branch 'release/1.0.3' into develop
Merge branch 'release/1.0.3'
Merge branch 'develop' into release/1.0.3
That turned out to be easier than I thought it would beâ€¦
Switch over to https to prevent MITM attacks.
Merge branch 'release/1.0.2' into develop
Merge branch 'release/1.0.2'
Remove unused files.
Ignore vim swap files, and start to handle multiple providers.
Get the makefile building in a bundled manner.
Add and validate a password type, and start to allow the extension to be bundled into TB core.
Fix the email_providers url, and use mozillamessaging.com instead of latte.ca.
Fix a typo and handle missing data.
Fix the LUHN check.
Remove debugging dumps.
Actually add the files I meant to, and an hgignore to ignore the xpi.

Get it working at startup (which was harder than you'ld think), and change the name to 'Get An Account'.

--HG--
rename : chrome/locale/en-US/accountprovisioner.dtd => chrome/locale/en-US/getanaccount.dtd
Fix the wording on the last page, and start to get it working under comm-central.
Move the tests to DropBox.
Make the add-on pass the AMO test suite.
Change single quotes to double quotes, and make the divs on the final page actually do stuff!
updated graphics for the final page
final page tweaks
align the cvv example image
make the e-mail address on the final page take up full width
fix the width of inputboxes to avoid vertical scrolling on the second page
Add the honest-to-goodness final urls.
Track high-level events, so that we can tell how people use the add-on.
Add a spinner, and a closing screen.
Change the button into a span when it hits the header.
Add a checkbox for the terms of service, and fix the error messages.
convergence of the two js files into the overlay for smashing global functions
override the AddMailAccount function in the account manager window and replace it with our own from our overlay.  a possible cleanup could be to merge this new file with the overlay js file.
Log successful account creations for bizdev and product decision reasons.
Why doesn't this work?
fixed the overflow so buttons at the bottom are visible
improve the text and make it a bit easier to read by going darker color and lighter background
window size hack to stop the buttons from being cut off
improvements to the 2nd page and I fixed the cmd-w listener
Add legal commentary, and terms of service.
Added tag v0.9 for changeset e082d9690f94
Switch over to 0.9, and the live momo servers.
Fix missing email bug.
Add client-side checks.
Add links to the Terms of Service and Privacy Policy, coming from the web service.
Don't open a compose window when we click an external link.
add the white border box to the settings detection

Oops, didn't check in soon enough.
Call web service to determine provisioners.
Use provisioner data to build form, and get order url.
Add spinner for Bryan.
carry over the style and size of the account provisioner to the account setup dialog
update some of the wording
remove an unused variable
more sweeping changes to catch up with the mockups and add some nice jenga strong animations
Scroll to the newly-highlit element.
Move one of the services over to our back-end.
big overhaul of the dialog to keep inline with the start page look
Add test script.
Fix the addresses appearing underneath the existing button.
Added tag v0.7 for changeset b727f9030eaf
Get the build.sh working better.
Get the provisioner errors hooked up.
handle the no-suggestions-returned case.
Update the API, to make the data a little more structured.
Fix up the provision call to post JSON.  (Including the email address!)
Add a link to the sample email account alternatives page.
Make the cost singular for all the addresses.
Make things a little smaller, to fit them on the screen better.
Add a back button to the second screen.
huge sweeping changes that aren't finished yet but this is a good checkpoint
Tag version 0.5 before we break everything.
Add files to build the xpi, and encode the query parameters.
Use geolocation to populate the location field, and save the first and last names into the account creation form.
Persist the name as well.
Move things around a little to get everything on one screen.
Call out to an external service when we change the username.
Add a name field for later use.
Professional-ify it up a little.
Fix some stuff gjslint found.
Create the account.
Start to add styling for the new_account block.
Make the buttons retain the correct state.
Add provisioner api call.
Rename the web service on latte.ca.
Handle multiple domains being returned from the check script.
Save the provisioner state between invocations.
Add enter handling to press the appropriate button.
Add a sample account submission form for Bryan to style.
Add the extension points as a diff to comm-central.
Go back to the two window way of doing things, cause it works.

Try using xhtml instead, on BenB's suggestion.

--HG--
rename : chrome/content/accountProvisioner.html => chrome/content/accountProvisioner.xhtml
Get it a little more working.
Continue putting the account wizard in an iframe.
Start putting the new account wizard in an iframe.

style the existing email account setup to look similar to our new version.  mv the css to the skin directory.

--HG--
rename : chrome/content/accountProvisioner.css => chrome/skin/accountProvisioner.css
Start the first steps towards using an external API.
Use the alternate, smaller design I got from Andy.
Move some stuff into other files.
Initial cut.
